page.title: 09SHOPPING SURVEY
page.content:
On the 9th of June, Sally{Rowntree and Emma{Boyle,}conducted a survey in West Hagley Village. Those questioned covered a wide variety of ages. { {Food} General opinion seemed to be that Hagley provided reasonably{good {facilities for purchasing food.}30% did their major weekly food shopping in Hagley, 28% in Stourbridge. Other shopping centres used, in order of preference, were Kidderminster, Halesowen, Worcester, Brierley Hill, and Birmingham.
{Clothes It was felt, especially by teenagers, that Hagley provided{poor {facilities for buying clothes.}40% usually bought their clothes in {Birmingham,}17% in Kidderminster, and
